trans-unit.source: Represents a smart tag panel item that is associated with a method in a class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem> class represents individual items in a smart tag panel.

An item of this type is displayed as an active user interface element, such as a hyperlink, that invokes a programmer-supplied method in a class derived from <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList>.
The association between the item and the method is maintained through the value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.MemberName%2A> property.
The method that this item invokes must neither take parameters nor return a value.

Individual panel items are associated together to form a panel by a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method and display names.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Category%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> properties to `null`, and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property to `false`.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method and display names, and a flag that indicates whether the item should appear in other user interface contexts.

If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then this item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu.
In [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], a command will also be added to the **Attributes** pane of the Properties window.
A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Category%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> properties to `null`.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
A flag that specifies whether to also treat the associated method as a designer verb.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method, display, and category names.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> property to `null` and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property to `false`.
For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
The case-sensitive <xref href="System.String"></xref> used to group similar items on the panel.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method, display, and category names, and a flag that indicates whether the item should appear in other user interface contexts.

If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then the item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu.
A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> property to `null`.
For more information on how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
The case-sensitive <xref href="System.String"></xref> used to group similar items on the panel.
A flag that specifies whether to also treat the associated method as a designer verb for the associated component.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method and category names, and display and description text.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property to `false`.
For more information on how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
The case-sensitive <xref href="System.String"></xref> used to group similar items on the panel.
Supplemental text for this item, used in ToolTips or the status bar.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> class, with the specified method and category names, display and description text, and a flag that indicates whether the item should appear in other user interface contexts.

If the `includeAsDesignerVerb` parameter is set to `true`, then this item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu.
A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that contains the method this item is associated with.
The case-sensitive name of the method in the class derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to invoke through the panel item.
The panel text for this item.
The case-sensitive <xref href="System.String"></xref> used to group similar items on the panel.
Supplemental text for this item, used in ToolTips or the status bar.
A flag that specifies whether to also treat the associated method as a designer verb for the associated component.
Gets a value that indicates the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> should appear in other user interface contexts.

If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is set to `true`, then the item is also considered a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb>; therefore, it will be added to the component's design-time shortcut menu.
A list of designer verbs can be accessed through the designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> collection property.
The value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is set in the constructor for this class.
`true` if the item is to be used in shortcut menus; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Programmatically executes the method associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.IncludeAsDesignerVerb%2A> property is initialized to `true`, the associated method can also be invoked through the corresponding designer verb event.
The method, named in <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.MemberName"></xref> cannot be found.
Gets the name of the method that this <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> is associated with.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem.MemberName%2A> property specifies which property, in the class derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class, that the item should be bound to.
When the programmer interacts with the panel item through the user interface (UI), this associated property will be set.
The bound method should neither take parameters nor return a value.
This property is set in the constructor.
It is case-sensitive.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the name of the associated method.
Gets or sets a component that contributes its <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem"></xref> objects to the current panel.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.RelatedComponent%2A> property allows another component to lend its smart tag panel items to the current list.
For example, a user control might aggregate the items from one of its constituent standard controls.
This property works in conjunction with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.AllowAssociate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The contributing component, which should have an associated designer that supplies items.
